0.summary: The body of Stephen Rakes, who said he was an extortion victim of James (Whitey) Bulger, was found in Lincoln, Mass., the authorities said.
0.title: Potential Witness in Bulger Trial Is Found Dead

1.summary: After weeks battling critical illness, Nelson Mandela spent his 95th birthday in the hospital on Thursday, and South Africans across the country celebrated Mandela Day.
1.title: Mandela Said to Be ‘Steadily Improving’ on 95th Birthday

2.summary: The law, championed by Gov. Rick Perry, bans abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy and requires abortion clinics to meet the same standards as hospital-style surgical centers.
2.title: Perry Signs Texas Abortion Restrictions Into Law

3.summary: The Palestinian leadership did not approve Secretary of State John Kerry’s plan for reviving peace talks with Israel, dulling hope for a breakthrough.
3.title: Palestinians Call Kerry’s Formula for Talks Insufficient

4.summary: What you need to know for Thursday: Unusual places to cool off on another very hot day, Nelson Mandela’s 95th birthday and a lost chicken is rescued in Brooklyn.
4.title: City Room: New York Today: Be Cool

5.summary: Aleksei A. Navalny, Russia’s most resonant opposition voice and a Moscow mayoral candidate, was sentenced to five years in prison on embezzlement charges.
5.title: Russian Court Convicts Opposition Leader

6.summary: The military judge in the trial of Pfc. Bradley Manning decided on Thursday not to drop a charge accusing Private Manning of “aiding the enemy.”
6.title: Judge in Manning Case Allows Charge of Aiding the Enemy

7.summary: Texas Gov. Rick Perry signed sweeping new abortion restrictions on Thursday that could shutter most of the clinics in the state.
7.title: Gov. Perry Signs Sweeping Abortion Restrictions

8.summary: British authorities said they had found signs of disruption in the battery cells of an emergency transmitter on a Boeing 787 that caught fire last week.
8.title: Investigators Point to Transmitter Battery in 787 Fire

9.summary: Dell adjourned a vote on its proposed $24.4 billion sale to its founder on Thursday morning, signaling that the planned transaction lacked enough support from shareholders.
9.title: DealBook: Dell Adjourns Vote on Deal as Some Big Investors Start to Shift

10.summary: Eight Afghan men heading to work at an American base on Thursday morning were pulled from their car by insurgents and killed, officials said.
10.title: Insurgents Kill 8 Afghans Near U.S. Base

11.summary: Morgan Stanley reported adjusted earnings for the second quarter that slightly beat analysts’ estimates, driven by a strong performance from its wealth management unit and equity sales and trading.
11.title: DealBook: Morgan Stanley Posts 42% Rise in Profit and Sets Stock Buyback

12.summary: JPMorgan Chase wants to settle accusations by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission that it gleaned profits from power plants via “manipulative schemes.”
12.title: DealBook: In Energy Case, a Fresh Tactic by JPMorgan: A Push to Settle

13.summary: The operator of the ravaged nuclear plant in Japan stood ready Thursday to inject boric acid into the reactor if temperature or radiation levels rose.
13.title: Steam Detected at Damaged Fukushima Reactor

14.summary: Sixty-one percent of voters said a candidate’s ability to understand the needs and problems of ordinary New Yorkers was the most important factor in the race.
14.title: Voters Approve of City’s Progress, Poll Finds, but Seek Empathetic Mayor

15.summary: A Russian judge on Thursday found opposition leader Alexei Navalny guilty of theft, a ruling that could send the charismatic anti-corruption blogger and Moscow mayoral candidate to prison for up to six years.
15.title: Russian Opposition Leader Navalny Found Guilty

16.summary: A fast-growing wildfire in the mountains of Southern California forced the evacuation on Wednesday of the popular resort community of Idyllwild after flames engulfed seven homes and numerous other buildings.
16.title: Southern California Wildfire Forces Evacuation of Mountain Resort

17.summary: A Pew survey found that since 2011, China’s approval rating in the United States dropped to 37 percent and negative attitudes toward the United States among the Chinese rose to 53 percent.
17.title: In China and U.S., Mutual Distrust Grows, Study Finds

18.summary: Higher rates of death from heart disease, cancer, homicide and diabetes help explain the 3.8-year gap in life expectancy between black and white Americans.
18.title: Racial Disparities in Life Spans Narrow, but Persist

19.summary: Waits are hours long for “Rain Room,” an installation at the Museum of Modern Art that has rain falling all around, but miraculously, not on you.
19.title: Steamy Wait Before a Walk in a Museum’s Rain

20.summary: The acquittal of George Zimmerman in the fatal shooting of Trayvon Martin has rattled any sense of security for black families, with parents even warning sons what not to wear.
20.title: Florida Case Spurs Painful Talks Between Black Parents and Their Children

21.summary: The judge hearing the case against Pfc. Bradley Manning said she would decide Thursday on his lawyers’ request to drop a charge accusing him of aiding the enemy.
21.title: Judge Expected to Decide on Charge of Aiding Enemy

22.summary: A group of activists is scrutinizing the Tour de France for hints of doping by comparing current performances with past ones. But the fairness of their methods has been questioned.
22.title: Watchdogs Seek Doping Clues From a Distance

23.summary: The expansive main hall at the World Trade Center complex could become a destination in its own right.
23.title: Building Blocks: A Transit Hub in the Making May Prove to Be the Grandest

-1.summary: The online network Netflix officially joined its cable and broadcast counterparts on Thursday, picking up a best drama nomination for the political thriller “House of Cards.”
-1.title: ArtsBeat: Netflix Does Well in 2013 Primetime Emmy Nominations
